channel.title: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?
channel.description:
Hello Axoloti community,
I have received my Axoloti core and am very eager to learn it so I can build the synths of my dreams. I am aware of the book "Getting Started with Axoloti" that came out in 2016 and I just want to see if the information is still current in regards to the objects and their functionality. I read the sample and liked the presentation and found it very helpful so hoping it will serve as a handy resource.
Thanks!

item.title: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

As @thetechnobear said, the only "new" thing introduced since the book was released is embedded subpatches. An update with some additions and changes is definitely due, but I haven't got the time yet to start writing.

Read full topic
item.source: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?

item.title: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?
item.dc:creator: @jmnes
item.description:
@jmnes wrote:

I bought the book maybe a month ago and the version is from March 2016. It is not updated for embedded patches, I had to search the forums to get that piece working.

Still a useful resource for a complete novice like myself.

Read full topic
item.source: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?

item.title: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

does it cover embedded patches?
that's probably the biggest change to patching since initial release.
(but just makes it easier than having to save subpatches , rather than any conceptual changes)

I thought @janvantomme mentioned somewhere he might do updates? â€¦ but could be Im mis-remembering.

Read full topic
item.source: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?

item.title: "Getting Started with Axoloti" book, still up to date?
item.dc:creator: @Inaba ramon
item.description:
@Inaba wrote:

it 99% is actually right now!
though you might find some minor changes to the GUI here and there, nothing major has changed to make the book unusefull.

Read full topic
